properties.name: Text
properties.value: An initial core group of the European members of WSBI (World Savings and Retail Banking Institute) and ESBG (European Savings and Retail Banking Group) have decided to join forces and launch a coordinated Financial Health Initiative (FHI) under the auspices of WSBI-ESBG.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Financial health can be defined as well-being in all matters financial. It means being in a good financial position now and being on track, via financial planning and personal risk coverage, to maintain it in the future – for financial health, like physical health, can be and almost always is influenced by external or unanticipated events.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: The cornerstone of the FHI is an innovative and holistic approach to giving advice based on the customer’s assessment of his or her financial health. The vision is to ensure that maintaining financial health becomes a way of life among the many, underpinned by such values as fairness, access and transparency. The FHI builds on the wide range of financial education and financial inclusion programmes carried out by WSBI-ESBG members.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Further information can be accessed on the website below:

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Crafted with care by www.beeone.at in Austria.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Find out how you and your money get along!

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Dirt cheap or a bit steep

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
How are you at assessing value for money on products and services.
Are you out of touch or do you know how much a carton of milk costs?

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
What is the average price of each of these products?
Drag the correct price label onto the product.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: 0.5l bottle of Coke from the supermarket

properties.name: Text
properties.value: 1 hour of labour for a plumber

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Do you keep it in a savings account or is it all under the mattress?
How do you save your money?

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Look at these questions and pick the answer that best suits you.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You save €100 every month. What would you rather do with the money?

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Put it in my piggy bank.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Transfer it into a savings account.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Give it to my loved ones.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You inherit €5,000 from your aunt. What would you do with the cash?

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Put it into a savings account.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Pack your bags and go on a weekend-trip to think about it.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: A business you invested in was sold last week. Your stake was valued at €800,000. What would you do with it?

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Put it into a savings account.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Invest in the business of a guy you met in a bar.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Open the restaurant that you have always dreamed about.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Keeping an eye on your cash

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Are you always in the red? Up to your eyeballs in debt?
Are you really in control of your expenses?

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Read the notes and tap the stamp that best suits you.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You know how much money you have in your account at all times.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You have a savings account, a current account and a secret place at home where you stash some cash.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You always know exactly how much cash you are carrying in your wallet.

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Maybe you know that you can handle all that life throws at you.
However, do you know how to handle money? Your money?

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Does the text on the card describe your relationship with money?
Put it on the correct stack.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I don’t really care about money.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I think long and hard before I spend my money.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I check my balance at least once a week.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I don’t trust anyone with my money.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I am well informed about money matters.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: When it comes to money, you can never be too careful.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: My dealings with money are rather aimless.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Are you up for making investments? Do you speculate to accumulate?

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Touch your friends and read what they have to say.
Then decide whose advice to take.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: All of a sudden you have €5,000 available. At the moment your current account is overdrawn by €3,000 because you had an unplanned expense recently – you smashed up your car. You need some advice.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Put the €5,000 in your current account and play it safe.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Split the €5,000 in two and invest both amounts, €2,500 into less volatile investments and €2,500 into a startup-fund which could earn you some real money within the next couple of years.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Use €3,000 to pay for a weekend trip to Paris as a treat for your partner’s birthday and put the rest (€2,000) into your current account.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Put €4,000 into your current account and invest the rest (€1,000) in stocks.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Put €3,000 into your current account to sort things out. The rest (€2,000) goes into the money box you labeled "car repairs".

properties.name: Text
properties.value: What is your attitude to risk? Do you like to gamble or play it safe?

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Are these statements true or false for you?
Move the arrow accordingly.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I would never ask a stranger to dance with me, even if I found them attractive.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I never use a helmet whilst skiing or cycling.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I don’t have a problem with exposing my data on the Internet.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I enjoy exotic food and love ordering dishes that surprise me.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I would never give up my full time job for a temporary one, even if I could earn much more money.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: In a restaurant, I only ever order dishes that I know.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: For an exciting holiday I would even consider travelling to a country that carries a travel warning.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: I mostly start my holidays without booking anything or making an itinerary.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: At sport, I always enjoy pushing myself to the limit.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: When grocery shopping, I try very hard to find the product with the longest expiry date.

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Do you think about life after work?
How do you provide for your future?

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Pick up, read all the post-its and keep the one you like best.
Throw the rest in the bin.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You have €46,247 at hand. Thinking about your future, what would your personal priority list look like?

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Pay back all your debts.
Store some of the money in a safe place in your house.
Buy a small piece of land to grow your own potatoes.

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Only pay back your debts that have the worst conditions attached to them.
Put 30% of the money into blue chips on the stock market.
Put the rest into your savings account.

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Invest €20,000 in the exciting startup that your friend told you about.
Put €5,000 in a high-risk fund that generated you a good return in the past.
Book that paragliding holiday you always wished you could afford.

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Invite all your best friends for a slap up dinner.
Book a round-the-world-trip. 
Leave the rest in your current account.

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Make a priority list and check the current conditions of all your accounts before you take a decision.
Put €800 on the side so you can pay for that boiler that needs to be replaced.
Put the rest into your savings account.

properties.name: Text
properties.value:
Your close friends think you are great at dealing with money.
Now they want some advice from you.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Use the red button to turn the pie chart to the option that you think is best.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Your friend has a decent amount of money and asks you how to invest it.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: of people taking this test are like you.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You’re not really that interested in your money, life is way too short. Having said that, you do care about your regular income and would definitely not risk a penny in a casino. You simply don’t have time to be bothered with loads of financial information, you have enough to do in your daily life. You’re running around on full gas fixing things and making sure that life runs smoothly for yourself and those around you. They call you Mr. Nice Guy or Mrs. Nice Girl, you’re everyone’s guardian angel! WOAH! Just slow down a second. We all need a super-hero from time to time and that includes you. You could probably do with your very own “Cashman” to fly down and rescue your finances.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Do you want to learn more on how to keep track of your expenses? Our website can tell you more about this.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Based on your test result, we have a product that might be of interest to you.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: This little test can only do so much. To find the perfect product that meets your current needs, how about talking with one of our advisors? They’re really nice and know lots about money and stuff.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Pessimism is your middle name, your glass is always half empty! You believe that all banks come from the depths of hell and financial advisors are vampires whose only interest is in bleeding you dry. You’re way too nervous to let all those monetary whizz-kids loose with your lolly! You know enough about money matters; however, you don’t really apply your financial know-how. If you could keep all your cash under your mattress you would, but you know that bank accounts are a necessary evil. Hey, come on relax, if you don’t start to show a little trust you’re going to be your own worst enemy.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Do you want to learn more on how to keep track of your expenses? Our website can tell you more about this.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Based on your test result, we have a product that might be of interest to you.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: This little test can only do so much. To find the perfect product that meets your current needs, how about talking with one of our advisors? They’re really nice and know lots about money and stuff.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: The Jolly Joker — carefree and positive

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You don’t need money to be happy and you have a positive and open attitude towards life but no time or interest to inform yourself about money matters. You’re too busy having fun spending your cash and if you spend money that you don’t have, who cares. Why drink beer when you can have Champagne? People who can give you advice about money are not the kind of people you want to hang out with, but you still trust them to get you a good deal. You want your money to work for you but you are too busy and too cool to really get involved. Just hang on a minute, you could actually spare a little time to get some good advice couldn’t you? You can always go to the pub afterwards!

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Do you want to learn more on how to keep track of your expenses? Our website can tell you more about this.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Based on your test result, we have a product that might be of interest to you.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: This little test can only do so much. To find the perfect product that meets your current needs, how about talking with one of our advisors? They’re really nice and know lots about money and stuff.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: The Smart Cookie — involved and ambitious

properties.name: Text
properties.value: You are one cool dude! You’re interested, well-informed and you take care of your cash. Finance is fun! You know that if you want to get the deal of a lifetime you have to be clued up and have your head screwed on. You’re great with money, you’re great with people, you’re great with business, in fact you’re just, well, GREAT! Hold on a minute. Are you really that great? Have you got the best deal? Is your money working as hard for you as you work for your money? Maybe, just maybe you could do with a bit of extra help.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Do you want to learn more on how to keep track of your expenses? Our website can tell you more about this.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Based on your test result, we have a product that might be of interest to you.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: This little test can only do so much. To find the perfect product that meets your current needs, how about talking with one of our advisors? They’re really nice and know lots about money and stuff.

properties.name: Text
properties.value: The Bean Counter — secure and controlled

properties.name: Text
properties.value: Your friends call you “The control freak money geek”, but you couldn’t care less about what they think. You know what’s going on in your accounts and you are most definitely not flash with your cash! So what if you use your mobile more as a calculator than a phone - you know this because you’re constantly checking your phone bills! For you money is a means to an end so you keep it tight, really tight. Rather than focusing on profit, you are concerned with security and you’re not going to let anyone mess you about. You’re very well informed but could maybe do with a bit of help from someone you trust. If you’re honest with yourself all this financial fretting is exhausting and you would really love to chill out, well a just little bit at least.
